parts.text: {"word":"engomarse","priority":"N/A","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"pronominal","definition":"(スペイン, スラング) (主に薬物やアルコールで) 酔う、ハイになる","english_definition":"(Spain, slang) to get drunk or high (usually from drugs or alcohol)","examples":[{"sentence":"Se engomó con unas cervezas en el bar.","translation":"He got drunk with a few beers at the bar.","usage_notes":"Refers specifically to becoming intoxicated.","collocations":["engomarse con cerveza (get drunk on beer)","engomarse con drogas (get high on drugs)"],"synonyms":["emborracharse","drogarse"],"antonyms":["desintoxicarse","estar sobrio"]}],"etymology":{"value":"恐らく「goma」(ゴム、接着剤)から派生。文字通りには「ゴムで覆われる」のような意味合いで、酩酊状態の感覚を表すスラング。","priority":"low"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/eŋ.ɡoˈmaɾ.se/","syllables":"en-go-mar-se"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["me engomo","te engomas","se engoma","nos engomamos","os engomáis","se engoman"],"past_simple":["me engomé","te engomaste","se engomó","nos engomamos","os engomasteis","se engomaron"],"future_simple":["me engomaré","te engomarás","se engomará","nos engomaremos","os engomaréis","se engomarán"],"present_subjunctive":["me engome","te engomes","se engome","nos engomemos","os engoméis","se engomen"],"past_subjunctive":["me engomara/engomase","te engomaras/engomases","se engomara/engomase","nos engomáramos/engomásemos","os engomarais/engomaseis","se engomaran/engomasen"],"imperative":["engómate (tú)","engómese (usted)","engomémonos (nosotros)","engomaos (vosotros)","engómense (ustedes)"]},"notes":"This is a pronominal verb, so it always requires a reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, os, se)."},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Engomarse' is a Spanish slang term, primarily used in Spain, to describe becoming intoxicated, usually through the consumption of alcohol or drugs. It is not a formal term and would typically be used in informal settings.","priority":"medium"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Yo engomo.","correct":"Yo me engomo.","note":"Because it's a pronominal verb, you must use the reflexive pronoun."}],"priority":"medium"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["goma (ゴム、接着剤)","engomado (酔った状態)"],"priority":"low"},"level_frequency":{"level":"B2 (slang)","frequency_google_ngram":"Low frequency","priority":"low"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"'Engomarse' is a slang term, so it's not commonly found in formal contexts. It's used to describe the state of being intoxicated, especially due to alcohol or drugs. It's important to remember that it's a pronominal verb, so it always needs a reflexive pronoun."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"Después de tres copas, ya se estaba engomando.","translation":"After three drinks, he was already getting drunk.","type":"example","meaning_category":"intoxication"},{"sentence":"No me quiero engomar esta noche, tengo que trabajar mañana.","translation":"I don't want to get drunk tonight, I have to work tomorrow.","type":"example","meaning_category":"intoxication"}]}
